instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.PP1V05_S5: What is PP1V05_S5? PP1V05_S5 is a 1.05v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. On 2008-2009 15” and 17” Macbook boards, this often gets stuck at 0.3v due to a bad C7771 capacitor. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Hello, This is my 1sr Post as i JUST Joined!!!...I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has a Green Light that turns to orange and ONLY Occasionally will boot up normally. it runs Perfect when it DOES start up... If i shut it down most of the time it will not start back up unless it sits for a while...once it starts up it will run off of the battery just fine and charges just fine...I have so far replaced...The Keyboard, The Battery, have replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> (Twice)...I am also using a Genuine 85w charger and Just cant figure this out!!!...PLEASE HELP!!!...Its DRIVING ME CRAZY!!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: I hope i'm Posting this in the Right Spot???...LOL...:rolleyes:

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message:
Also...Here are some of the Power rails I have measured.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>..... 12.6v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_CPU_IMVP_ISNS</SIGNAL>....  12.56v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>.....  16.7v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.....3.38v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>....5.95v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>.....3.3v

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL>.....0.0v

<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S5</SIGNAL>....0.0v

HOPE SOMEONE can Help Me...Thank You...Sorry if I am Coming across as an idiot on here as this is my first Post here and i HAVE NO IDEA if I am even posting correctly!!...lol...Thank You Again in advance for Your help.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is a bit high, you sure you're measuring the right spot?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Correction....<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is ...4.95v  NOT 5.95v...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: ANY Help would be Greatly Appreciated.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Does it power on SMC reset??

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: When it doesn't want to work it won't even power on with a SMC Reset Power on attempt...It like it goes  Completeley Dead...It has me 100% stumped!!!...I Just went in and it turned right on With the Charger connected....I unplugged the Charger and it continued running Perfectly then an Hour later I shut it down and AGAIN Zero response when.attempting to turn it back on with or without the Charger...Whenever It does that where it won't turn back on The MagSafe light on the Charger does turn green when the power button is pressed but it won't power up????

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Check for water damage, check PP3V42V and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> when it does not want to power on..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Hi, I put it thru the ultrasonic cleaner already as it has a bit of corrosion around the J6995 area as well as the <CHIP>U5930</CHIP> area...Also When it would not boot again today after it ran perfectly for about 2 Hours I then checked <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and Get 12.56v on pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R5388</RESISTOR> and also checked PP3V42 on L6995 and I Get 3.38v on poth pin and pin 2....Anyone have any ideas?...Please...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: I also checked <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with just the Battery installed and no magsafe attached and I get 12.39 on <RESISTOR>R5388</RESISTOR>(Pin2)....is it Normal to get 12.56V With Boyh the Battery and the Charger connected and only 12.39v with Just the Battery connected?...in SO STUMPED RIGHT NOW!!!...LOL...Anyone Have any suggestions where to start???

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> would be the battery voltage when its the only power source connected, don't worry about it. 12.39V means the battery is holding a good amount of charge.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Ahh...Okay...What could be causing it to not start up every time?...Any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Thank You for your reply Smiba

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: :) Well I Guess since it's New Year's Eve all the Experts are Partying  and Celebrating!!!...HOPEFULLY the Calvary will arrive in the next couple of days before I throw this thing out the window...WITHOUT OPENING IT!!...lol...Happy New Years to All of You!!!!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: I still say water damage some where  or crap under SMC, ultrasonic cleaner does not make bad connection becomes good!!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: I have Completely checked for water damage Everywhere on the Board and it all looks Good. The area around the SMC was Very clean before the Ultrasonic cleaning and there was Very Little corrosion near the J6995 area before cleaning. Should I Try putting Flux around the SMC and heating it up a little just in case?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Could be so many things. As this was liquid damage and already cleaned all evidence is now gone. Could be crap under the SMC or PCH or corroded resistor or trace, inspect closely under microscope.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Okay will do Duke...Thank You So Much for responding!!!...I am going to look VERY CLOSELY at the Entire Board and I will get back to you...I did notice that when it won't turn on I get 0.0v on the PP1V05 Rail and also 0V on all s3 and S0 Rails...I will look CLOSELY under the Microscope.....Thanks Again Duke

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Okay...I have checked EVERYWHERE on the Board under the microscope and see no corrosion or corroded caps...The only place there was a small amount of corrosion was around the J6995 area...Its Nice and clean now...the Laptop works Absolutely perfect until I turn it off and then it wont restart unless you wait about 45min to an Hour...SO WEIRD!!!.. PLEASE HELP!!!!...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: This is going to suck, its corrosion somewhere. Reflow the SMC with good flux and see what happens.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Yup, this is going to suck. Probably corrosion under SMC or PCH. Flux and some heat, not a full reflow, just let it bubble for a bit to try and clear the crap.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Thanks Duke...Should i Flux and heat the PCH Also?...So Weird considering there was NO liquid damage Anywhere near the SMC...Not even a discolored trace it Test Point anywhere in the area...I will give it a shot though as I trust in Your expertise...I'll let you know how it goes...How much heat in Farenhite and for how long do you Suggest I heat it for?...Thanks Again Guys

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: There is no expertise in this one. Problems like this are just guess work. There are no temps I can give. You should have a "feel" for how hot you make the board. Just let the flux bubble for a bit.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Thank You Duke!!!!...I cleaned the SMC Area Extensivly

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only starts up occasionally
threads.message: Then I put a pretty Good Amount of Amtech Flux all around the SMC and heated it up Pretty Good at about 350 Degrees then a Little Bit at 400 Degrees it was Bubbling pretty Good but not Hot enough to melt the Solder and...Now it Works PERFECTLY!!!...Thank You Duke and Everyone for Your Help...ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS FORUM and Louis Rossman's You tube Channel as well... Thanks Again :)
